title: The zemstvo reform of 1864 came in response to the abolition of serfdom in Rus­sia three years earlier. The zemstvo system created a network of elected, mostly autonomous local governing bodies charged with administration of the Rus­sian countryside—­a nd ­later its cities—­ instead of the state or nobles, which no longer had the means or authority to govern Rus­sia’s vast hinterland.
